intro: Tragia virgata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Tragia virgata is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some areas.
